info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 1:54AM EDT until September 27 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following counties, Alleghany NC, Ashe and Wilkes.
* WHEN...Until 400 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 151 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicates light to occasionally moderate rain across the advisory area. However, between 3 and 3.5 inches of rain fell earlier this evening over a short period of time near Wilkesboro. Runoff from this rain continues to collect in local creeks and stream, with some of them still out of their banks, though water levels continue to fall. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Cane Creek, East Prong Roaring River, Bee Tree Branch, Darnell Creek, Big Bugaboo Creek, Clear Branch, Church Branch, Cub Creek, Camp Branch, Big Sandy Creek, Cove Creek and Basin Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Wilkesboro... Wilkesboro... Ronda... Mc Grady... Wilbar... Traphill... Laurel Springs... - For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING

area.areaDesc: Alleghany, NC; Ashe, NC; Wilkes, NC
